in_brief: Focus on value and benefits, not features
Success instead of fear, doubt and uncertainty

rules.name: Text should have a purpose
do: Remove text that does not help the user act, decide, or understand what happens next.
Prefer communicating through UI design when words are trying to explain what the UI should show.
dont: Add text just to fill space or restate what the UI already makes clear.

rules.name: Be explicit, be direct
do: Prioritize clarity over brevity.
Include key context needed to understand what happened and what to do next.
dont: Omit important details just to make copy shorter.

rules.name: Focus on value and benefits, not features
do: Describe what the user gains (time saved, impact, outcome).
Use the customer’s language and mental model.
dont: Lead with internal feature names or technical implementation details.

rules.name: There is no default knowledge
do: Assume the user may not know jargon, acronyms, or system behavior.
Explain unfamiliar terms or introduce acronyms before using them.
dont: Use unexplained acronyms, slang, or technical jargon.

rules.name: Prefer the positive
do: Describe what the user can do and the path forward.
Use positive directives when possible.
dont: Overemphasize restrictions, blocks, or limitations when an available path exists.

rules.name: Success instead of fear, doubt and uncertainty
do: Reduce uncertainty with clear reassurance when appropriate.
Explain what will happen and what will not happen when that matters.
dont: Use fear-based framing or language that increases doubt without offering a path forward.

tone.description: Helpfulness may show up as empowering, empathetic, or confident depending on context.

do: Give guidance while keeping user agency.
Include supportive context (what happens next / where they can change it later).
dont: Over-instruct or imply the user must do something when it’s optional.

recommended: Create and manage gift cards. Visit the Help Center to learn more about gift card features and options.
Turn off guest alerts. Guests won't receive notifications anymore. You can always enable them later on the Settings page.
not_recommended: Create and manage gift cards. Use this section to set up your gift cards.
Disable guest alerts. Guests won't receive notifications anymore.

do: Keep the user calm with clear, uncluttered language.
Provide a viable next step when possible.

when_to_use: Explaining product behavior that requires trust
do: Emphasize user benefit and time saved.
Support trust with clear reasoning.
dont: Be arrogant or imply we know the customer’s business better than they do.
Frame it like we’re doing the customer a favor.
notes: Be careful with words like 'easy' since difficulty is subjective.

do: Explain why the feature exists and what the user gains.
Offer clear CTAs that move the user forward.
Invite rather than instruct.
dont: Assume the user’s priorities or why they haven’t used a feature.
Assume what is easy for you is easy for them.

do: Explain what happened in clear language.
Tell the user how to move forward when possible.
Reduce pressure by clarifying what can be done later.
Use empowering language that supports progress.
dont: Use imperative tone when actions aren’t imperative.
